properties.name: Angus Barn (Wild Turkey Lounge)
properties.description: Posted by Michael9401 Glenwood Avenue, Raleigh, NCThe Angus Barn is a favorite steakhouse among the locals and visitors. They also sport a humidor of hard to find (if a little overpriced) cigars and a comfortable upstairs bar called the Wild Turkey Lounge.

properties.name: Aromas Cigars
properties.description: Posted by Michael4372 Southside Blvd, Jacksonville, FLA cigar bar with an inhouse walk-in humidor. The humidor sports a fine selection, including some upscale brands such as the Arturo Fuente OpusX. The venue has music on occassion, and a friendly bar staff. A private club is available for those that want to segregate themselves from the common folk, or who just really want the snazzy cigar locker that comes with the membership fee.

properties.name: Collins
properties.description: Posted by Michael735 8th Ave, New York, NYAn excellent scottish bar with a very impressive scotch menu. It\'s positioning in NY makes it non-cigar friendly, but still worth visiting for the scotch enthusiast.

properties.name: Georgetown Tobacco
properties.description: Posted by Michael 3144 M Street NW, Washington, DCGeorgetown offers a fine array of pipes and pipe tobacco. In a pinch though, the avid cigar fan can find a decent selection for a night out on the town in the chic and stylish nooks of the NW quad. Georgetown does not offer a smoking room for their customers, so it\'s purely a shop and go venue.

properties.name: Mike Ditka's
properties.description: Posted by Michael100 East Chestnut Street, Chicago, ILMike Ditka\'s cigar bar. I found this to be a friendly establishment (perhaps with more sports paraphenalia on the wall than I would have expected), but it has a great drink menu, and of course it\'s cigar friendly.

properties.name: Morton's
properties.description: Posted by Michael 849 E. Commerce Street, San Antonio, TXLike other Morton\'s, this location is cigar friendly and serves an excellent steak and potatoes dinner, ala carte. After dinner, you can retire to the bar for dessert and cigar. The venue is also convenient to the Alamo and River Street, so it makes a good beginning or end to site seeing around the city for pedestrian explorers.

properties.name: My Cigars
properties.description: Posted by Michael3795 E NORTH ST STE 16, Greenville, SCA comfortable and friendly cigar cafe where locals congregate and enjoy fine cigars. The venue offers a fine selection with their walk-in humidor and the best cup of coffee in town. Be sure to ask Tim how to properly light a cigar if you\'ve never had his advice before. Even for the seasoned cigar smoker, it\'s worth the experience. For visitors, the sign above the store reads G&G.

properties.name: Ozio Restaurant and Lounge
properties.description: Posted by Michael  1813 M St NW, Washington, DCIf you\'re looking for a cigar bar and dance club mix, then this is your place. Not quite hospitible to a quiet evening to catch up with old friends, but fun if you\'re looking for a hip place to hang out and enjoy a cigar. I\'d recommend a mid-range cigar for this venue though, because you might not enjoy a finer cigar to its full extent.

properties.name: Sambuca Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Michael 909 Texas Avenue, Houston, TXA clazzy Jazz club with an upstairs cigar bar. Full of character and style, Sambuca provides a cozy atmosphere for a night out. The upstairs cigar bar is nestled away for privacy, but seating alongside the Jazz stage is also available. Both times I\'ve been here, the music was excellent, and the ambiance is hard to beat.

properties.name: Sunset Grille
properties.description: Posted by Michael 5850 Fayetteville Rd, Durham, NCA friendly restaurant with fine food, a decent scotch and bourbon menu, with outdoor seating, and a cigar friendly atmosphere.

properties.name: The Occidental
properties.description: Posted by Michael471 Pine St, San Francisco, CAA cigar bar with a friendly pub-like atmosphere but a little more modern scenery. The bar is stocked beyond any other bar I\'ve seen, including a veritable catalog of fine scotch, bourbon, aged rums, among others. The bar tenders are always friendly. If you\'re short on time, you can even order dinner from the fine Italian restaurant next door -- who will then bring the entire table setting, bread, cloth napkin and all over to you for your dining pleasure. Try the Lamb Stew -- an excellent beginning for night of fine cigar smoke and drinking.
